column5: Hello all, Im 66 years old and am finally going to do a fly in trip. My son has booked us a trip with 7 lakes wilderness outfitters for June 20th week, staying at there outpost camp. Any and all info would be helpful as I have been looking forward to one of these for 20 years. Hoping this is a good lake and a good place to stay. Info of any kind that would make our trip more successful would be appreciated. Good stuff, bad stuff, whatever. Fishing maps with hot spots marked would be appreciated. Do I need a fish finder, hot baits that work for pike, walleye, and perch spots would be appreciated. Thanks in advance.

Hey good luck on your trip. Sounds like a once in a lifetime type thing. I am sure you will have blast.I don't have any specific information you are looking for but there have been some great conversations the last couple months on here. If you scroll through the topics there is one on rod and real combos, meal planning along with countless others.A good starter read is https://www.walleyecentral.com/forum...d.php?t=702812I would also go through and do a search for Mike Borger. He has went to countless resorts and provides excellent reports on each one. If nothing else watching all his videos about trips that he has taken and has taken his son to will occupy the good part of the week. His website is here, you can check if the place you are going is one he has been to. https://www.canadafishingguide.net/r.../fly-in-trips/

Here is my journal from my first trip to Meta and Ara Lakes back in 2014...it's a long read, but you might find it interesting.https://www.walleyecentral.com/forum...ight=meta+lake I've been back there 5 times and have plans to be there in August again this season. Hopefully, we'll still be able to go.
PM me. Have been to Ara 6-8 times. Can give you lots of info. Mike
You picked a good week for your first trip. You should hammer them. Congrats an look forward to your trip report.

Good luck out there! Ara/meta/brace look like a awesome body of water. Me and my group just planned a trip to Ara lake in early june 2021! Already looking forward to it. Youl have to let me know how the trip goes!
Hope they can accommodate you later in the year as it does not look good to open up anytime soon.

Our trip last year did not happen, has been re-scheduled for June 12-19 2021, hope this happens, Im still trying to get information from those who have gone there before. Maps with marked up spots, plus Im taking my gps/fishfinder. Hope to find a good perch spot as well as pike, I know walleyes are not an issue at this place, there everywhere.
